text: many general-purpose workloads don't
need sustained fixed CPU resources all
the time
worst of all instances help get you the
compute resource your workload needs
whenever and for as long as you need it
while still keeping your costs low so
the burstable instances are an instance
family from ec2 which provide a
guaranteed level of CPU performance with
the ability to burst to high levels of
CPU utilization for transient or spiky
loads now each instance has a baseline
CPU which is governed by what we call
the CPU credits CPU credits get used
while the instance is active and they
accumulate when the instance is
operating below the CPU baseline
burstable instances are used for most
general purpose applications that can
benefit from quick access to high levels
of CPU whenever needed but most of the
time are using moderate levels of CPU
additionally t2 and t3 burstable cpu
instances are the only option for nano
micro and small instance sizes making
them a good choice if you're running a
smaller workload that doesn't need the
capacity of larger instance type t3 is
the newest generation general-purpose
burstable instance family it is a
successor to t2 and was launched on
August 21st this year t3 offers roughly
about 30% better price to performance
over the previous generation t2
instances they are powered by high
frequency Intel Xeon processor based on
new Intel's
microarchitecture called skylake thank
you for joining me
